		Question: what was james garfield most known for
		Answer:
answer: James Abram Garfield was the 20th president of the United States. He was a member of the Republican Party and served from March 4, 1881, until his assassination on September 19, 1881. Garfield was born in Moreland Hills, Ohio, on November 19, 1831. He graduated from Williams College in 1856 and practiced law in Ohio before entering politics. Garfield served in the Ohio Senate from 1859 to 1861 and in the U.S. House of Representatives from 1863 to 1880. He was a strong supporter of President Abraham Lincoln during the Civil War and served as a general in the Union Army. After the war, Garfield continued to serve in the House of Representatives and became a leading member of the Republican Party. He was elected president in 1880 and took office on March 4, 1881. Garfield's presidency was marked by his efforts to reform the civil service and to improve relations with foreign countries. He was also a strong supporter of education and civil rights. Garfield was assassinated by Charles J. Guiteau on July 2, 1881, and died on September 19, 1881. He was succeeded by Vice President Chester A. Arthur.
